criteria: Quality of Analysis, Reflection, and Research
descriptions: No evidence is drawn from the text.
Evidence is irrelevant or demonstrates misunderstanding of the text.
Evidence is limited, vague, or not clearly connected to the analysis, reflection, or research.
Evidence is relevant but may lack depth or strong connection to the analysis, reflection, or research.
Evidence is well-chosen and supports the analysis, reflection, or research effectively.
Evidence is compelling, insightful, and strongly enhances the analysis, reflection, or research.
Analysis, reflection, or research is absent or demonstrates a complete misunderstanding of the text.
Analysis, reflection, or research is superficial or lacks a clear purpose.
Analysis, reflection, or research is present but underdeveloped and lacks depth.
Analysis, reflection, or research is adequate but may contain generalizations or unsupported claims.
Analysis, reflection, or research is thoughtful, well-reasoned, and supported by the evidence.
Analysis, reflection, or research is sophisticated, insightful, and demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the text.
Writing is unclear, disorganized, and difficult to understand.
Writing lacks coherence and contains significant grammatical errors.
Writing is somewhat organized but may contain lapses in clarity and coherence.
Writing is generally clear and organized with minor grammatical errors.
Writing is clear, coherent, and effectively communicates the analysis, reflection, or research.
Writing is exceptionally clear, concise, and effectively engages the reader with the analysis, reflection, or research.
